Itinerary.day_header: Arrive Singapore - Half day city tour
Itinerary.day_detail:
On arrival in Changi International Airport you will be transferred to your hotel. Check in to the
hotel. This morning we proceed on a half day city tour of Singapore visit Merlion Park, Chinatown,
Mount Faber, Jewellery Factory, Chocolate Shop, Little India. Overnight at the hotel in Singapore.
Optional : Later in the evening proceed to Night Safari. The world’s first nocturnal wildlife park,
the Night Safari is one of Singapore’s best-known attraction.

Today enjoy Jurong Bird Park in Singapore for a family-friendly adventure among various bird
species, from parrots to penguins. Its is home to the world's largest walk-in lory flight aviary at
3,000 square metres and over 9 stories high. Featuring 10 colourful lory species, this exhibit is a
favourite amongst guests who get to feed the gregarious lories a nectar mix while observing them
up close. Overnight at the hotel in Singapore. (B)

Today proceed for Gardens by the bay be mesmerised by stunning waterfront views at the award-
winning horticultural destination that is Gardens by the Bay. Gardens by the Bay offers an enjoyable
time for the entire family. Marvel at a city garden spanning 101 hectares of reclaimed land at
Gardens by the Bay. Overnight at the hotel in Singapore. (B)

This morning you will be transferred to Changi International Airport for your flight back home or
your next destination. (B)

All Transfers and Sightseeing as per itinerary on seat in coach basis
Tokyo city tour
Mt Fuji and Hakone tour by motor coach
JR Pass (Ordinary Class – Unreserved seats)
Full Day Kyoto and Nara tour
Full day Hiroshima and Miyajima Island tour

Itinerary.day_detail:
Welcome to Japan. Upon arrival you will be transferred to the hotel on Seat In Coach
basis. Check in to the hotel. Rest of the day is on leisure. Overnight at the hotel in
Tokyo.

This morning after breakfast at the hotel proceed to Cherry Blossom Tour. Head to
the designated locations on your own (hotels in Tokyo) for the Pickup. Meguro River
Chartered Cherry Blossom Cruise, then proceed to Chidorigafuchi, Shinjuku Gyoen.
Enjoy the beautiful cherry blossom season and capture the scenic beauty in your
camera. Tour ends at Shinjuku West Exit. Overnight at the hotel in Tokyo. (B)

Today proceed to visit Mt Fuji and Hakone. Gather at designated locations (hotels in
Tokyo) on your own and board the bus. Mt. Fuji 5th Station, Lake Ashi Cruise, Mt.
Komagatake Ropeway. Depart Hakone and return to Tokyo by bus. Tour will disbands
upon arrival at Ginza. Head to your hotel on your own. Overnight at the hotel in
Tokyo. (B & L)

Proceed to Tokyo Station on your own. Reach Tokyo Station and board the
Shinkansen Train from Tokyo To Osaka using your JR pass. Transfer to the hotel in
your own. Check in to the hotel. Overnight at the hotel in Osaka. (B)

Early morning proceed to proceed to departure point for Kyoto and Nara tour and
visit places such as Nijo Castle, Kinkaku-ji Temple. Then you will visit Imperial
Palace. Imperial Palace is the former residence of the Imperial Family. Head to Nara.
visit Nara park, Todaiji Temple, the world's largest wooden building, which houses a
colossal image of Buddha, Kasuga Shrine, Nara Nagomikan. Tour ends after arriving
at Osaka Station. Head to the hotel on your own. Overnight at the hotel in Osaka. (B)

Itinerary.day_header: Osaka – Hiroshima And Miyajima Island Tour
Itinerary.day_detail:
This morning after breakfast head to Shin-Osaka Station on own. Board the
Shinkansen Bullet train to Hiroshima by using the JR Pass . Tour start at Hiroshima
Station, Miyajima, Itsukushima Shrine, Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park & Museum,
Atomic Bomb Dome. Later in the evening depart from Hiroshima Station back to
Osaka by Shinkansen Bullet train using your JR Pass. Head to the hotel on your own.
Overnight at the hotel in Osaka. (B)

Morning after breakfast. Today the day is at leisure you may explore Osaka's streets
and markets on your own. Overnight at the hotel in Osaka. (B)

Today proceed to Kansai airport to board fight to your home town/ Next Destination.
(B)

To make advance E Permit, guide is mandatory throughout the tour.
Hotels are very strict with the child policy. Please carry the age proof so that it can be produced when asked for

Room category in all packages is the Base Category
Vehicles will be changed as per the transport regulations in the sector
Vehicle will be given Point to Point as per itinerary & not on Disposal Basis
Package is not valid during high season, festive period / peak period.

Two Nights Accommodation in Paro

Itinerary.day_detail:
On arrival at Bagdogra airport / New Jalpaiguri railway station you will be
transferred to the hotel in Phuentsholing. Rest of the day is at leisure. Overnight at
the hotel in Phuentsholing

Today proceed to Thimpu through the mountains, this journey is of almost
unbelievable beauty. The road leads from the northern Indian tea plantations through
endless turns, hair pin bends and daring stretches carved into the mountain rock via
Chukka to Thimphu. Check in the hotel. Later in the evening spend some time in
clock tower square. Overnight at the hotel in Thimpu. (B)

Today proceed to Sightseeing tour visit Folk Heritage Museum, National Library,
Handicraft Center to view the traditional arts, Tashichho Dzong, Takin Zoo. Later
National Memorial Chorten a stupa dedicated to the third king of Bhutan and Buddha
statue. Rest of the day is at leisure. Overnight at the hotel in Thimpu. (B)

Itinerary.day_header: Thimphu – Punakha Via Dochula Pass (Approx 85 Kms / 2 hrs 30 mniutes)
Itinerary.day_detail:
Today drive to low lands of Punakha valley touching Dochula pass 10,000 ft and on
the stop at Hongtsho village. . Check in the hotel. Afternoon visit majestic Punakha
Dzong placed strategically at the junction of the Pho Chu and Mo Chu rivers, the
dzong was built in 1637 by Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal to serve as the religious
and administrative seat of the region. Later visit Punakha Dzong & Punakha
Suspension Bridge. Rest of the day is at leisure. Overnight at the hotel in Punakha.
(B)

Today proceed to beautiful Gangtey valley via Wangdiphodrang Dzong strategically
located on a ridge 4,430 ft that overlooks the highway that fork to the east and south
of the country. This is an old town with Narrow Street with single storied shops and
also the gateway to central and eastern Bhutan. The Gangtey valley is one of the most
beautiful open valleys in Bhutan and is the winter home to the endangered black
necked cranes (Grus Nigricllis) which migrate to this valley around mid November
from Tibet. These cranes have for centuries captured the human imagination with
their intelligence, poise, sociality, beauty and freedom which have given rise to
several myths, legends, folktales and songs. The birds fy back across the Himalayas
to their summer home towards Tibet and China. The Gangtey village is small
dominated by the yellow roofed Gangtey monastery. Overnight at the hotel in
Punakha. (B)

This morning drive to Paro and stop at Lamperi. Visit the Royal Botanical Park . In
the Afternoon visit ruins of Drukgyel Dzong and drive till the base of Tigers Nest.
Overnight at the hotel in Paro. (B)

Today after breakfast enjoy Paro sightseeing visit Paro Dzong, National Museum.
Later drive till the base of world famous “Tigers Nest “or popularly known as “Paro
Taktsang” one of the popular spiritual heritage sites that literally hangs on a granite
clif overlooking the Paro valley at 900m above the valley foor. The temple is
associated with Guru Rimpoche who visited in 8th century. Rest of the day is at
leisure. Overnight at the hotel in Paro. (B)

Today Proceed to Phuentsholing visit Kharbandi Gompa. Rest of the day is at leisure.
Overnight at the hotel in Phuentsholing. (B)

This morning you will be transferred to Bagdogra airport / New Jalpaiguri railway
station to board your fight/train back home or to your next destination. (B)
